fixes.name: TC_Value
fixes.solution_explanation: Tableau's WINDOW_MAX(MAX([Value])) is a table calculation that returns the maximum of the aggregated Value over the window/partition. In DAX, this is approximated by taking the MAX of 'Data (Complaint Line)'[Value] evaluated over the current selection context using ALLSELECTED('Data (Complaint Line)') to emulate Tableau's window/partition scope.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses a table calculation (WINDOW_MAX) and an aggregation (MAX), which requires evaluation across rows/partitions â€” this must be implemented as a measure in Power BI.
